title: UCSI University signs memo with PHP Motors
body: The UCSI University Bangladesh signed a memorandum of understanding with the PHP Motors Limited in the hall room of UCSI at Banani in Dhaka on Thursday. This collaboration aims to provide various opportunities for students, including internships, research initiatives, and workshops, thereby enhancing educational experiences for UCSI students, said a press release. Mohd Shuhada Othman, high commissioner of Malaysia to Bangladesh, was present as chief guest at the event. Mohammad Akhtar Parvez, managing director of PHP Motors Limited; Ariful Bari Majumdar, senior vice-president of UCSI University Bangladesh and chairman and MD of Insight Institute of Learning; and Professor Mohd Kushairi Bin Mohd Rajuddin, pro-vice-chancellor of UCSI University Bangladesh, among others, were present at the event. The MoU was signed on behalf of UCSI University Bangladesh by Professor Shah Samiur Rashid, registrar; and Taseer Karim, executive director of PHP Motors Limited. Professor Kushairi highlighted the academic excellence that UCSI University aimed to achieve and expressed optimism that this partnership would be mutually beneficial. Mohammad Akhter Parvez emphasised that the MoU would open new doors for students at UCSI University Bangladesh, stating, ‘We are proud to collaborate with UCSI University, and we see assisting students as our responsibility.’ Shuhada Othman remarked that the agreement between PHP Motors and UCSI University Bangladesh symbolised a meaningful development. ‘This cooperation will undoubtedly enhance professional skills within both organisations and provide Bangladeshi students with access to high-quality education, aligned with international standards.’
